questions.question_text: An ISP is providing internet to a retail store and has terminated its point of connection using a standard Cat 6 pin-out. Which of the following terminations should the technician use when running a cable from the ISP's port to the front desk?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The BEST termination to use when running a cable from the ISP's port to the front desk in a retail store that has a standard Cat 6 pin-out is B. TIA/EIA-568-B.

TIA/EIA-568-B is a standard for structured cabling, which includes the pin-outs for various types of Ethernet cables, including Cat 6. Using TIA/EIA-568-B standard ensures that the cable is terminated correctly, which can help prevent network connectivity issues and signal interference. This standard is widely used in the telecommunications industry and is the recommended choice for terminating Cat 6 cables.

Selected Answer: B
B is the only termination standard mentioned, the others are connector standards.

Selected Answer: A
A. NFV (Network Functions Virtualization).

NFV allows network functions, such as firewalls, routers, and load balancers, to be virtualized and run on industry-standard servers instead of having dedicated hardware appliances. This approach enables network services to be rapidly deployed, scaled, and managed in a more flexible and cost-effective manner. By using NFV, the company can create a virtual replica of its physical network, with the same logical topology and behavior, while running network functions as virtualized instances.

Selected Answer: A
I think there's typo in answer A. It should be NFV, Network Function Virtualization not NVF.
Network Function Virtualization(NFV) is the process of taking networking functions such as routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, and controllers and virtualizing them. This process allows all these functions to run on a single device. - CompTIA Net+ Study guide page 24.

answer is A , I think there's a typo

To virtualize a replica of its internal physical network without changing the logical topology and the way that devices behave and are managed, Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) is the most suitable technology. NFV allows you to abstract and virtualize network services and functions, such as routers, firewalls, and load balancers, without altering the underlying logical network topology or how devices are managed. This technology enables the creation of virtual network instances that mimic the behavior of physical network components, maintaining consistency with the existing network architecture and management practices.

Selected Answer: A
it is A

Selected Answer: A
A. NFV IS the virtualization of network hardware. SDWAN can be used to control NVF devices. SDWAN is Software used to control and manage a Wide Area Network.
It is a typo. It is NFV not NVF.

Selected Answer: B
SD-WAN is a virtualized service that connects and extends enterprise networks over large geographical distances. WANs use links such as multiprotocol label switching (MPLS), wireless, broadband, virtual private networks (VPNs) and the internet to give users in branch and remote offices access to corporate applications, services and resources, allowing them to work regardless of location

comments.content: SD-WAN is Software Defined WAN....... WAN...... Its literally in the title. We are discussing a LAN in the question. Therefor A is the only answer.

questions.question_text: A company needs to virtualize a replica of its internal physical network without changing the logical topology and the way that devices behave and are managed. Which of the following technologies meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. PTR (Pointer) record.

A PTR record is a type of DNS record that maps an IP address to a domain name. Reverse lookup checks are used to verify that an IP address is associated with a valid domain name, and are commonly used in anti-spam and anti-phishing measures. In the case of an external mail server, a PTR record would need to be configured in the DNS server for the domain name that corresponds to the server's IP address. This would allow reverse lookup checks to verify that the mail server is authorized to send email from the domain name associated with its IP address.

When both SPF and PTR is present it is about the wording used. SPF specifies which IPs are allowed to send emails
PTR can be used to do "reverse" lookups. So, I will have to go for PTR

comments.content: "pass reverse lookup checks" << I have to employ an english language expert. I might go for SPF.
Wait, I will go for PTR. Impossible question. Because both are used when the recipient-email-server receives the email

Here it says reverse lookup "checks". This certification is about English language proficiency (or lack of it). Does check means verification then it could be SPF. I hope the certification industry grow some morality

questions.question_text: A network technician needs to ensure the companyâ€™s external mail server can pass reverse lookup checks. Which of the following records would the technician MOST likely configure?

comments.content: I agree with this ^. I don't believe load balancing is quite that granular with it stating per user per device.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Bandwidth management is the process of measuring and controlling the communications (traffic, packets) on a network link, to avoid filling the link to capacity or overfilling the link, which would result in network congestion and poor performance of the network.

The answer is A. Reason is that Bandwidth management is there to limit the maximum amount a user can use per connection. Load Balancing is there to split the load of the amount of connected users between 2 or more routers as to not overload the network.

Selected Answer: A
Layer 2 Quality of Service (QoS) allows for traffic prioritization & Bandwidth Management to minimize network delay using Cost of Service (CoS) classification, & Differentiated Services Code Point DSCP marking under the 802.1p standard. Layer 3 Quality of Service (QoS) allows for managing the quality of network connections through its packet routing decisions.

Selected Answer: A
Recourse allocation at application level can only be done by bandwidth management.

Selected Answer: A
Load balance routing (Option B) is a technique used to distribute network traffic across multiple servers to ensure that no single server bears too much demand. This helps to increase the reliability and availability of applications. However, it does not prioritize Internet usage per application and per user on the network. That's the job of bandwidth management (Option A), which can allocate network resources to ensure critical applications get the bandwidth they need.

Bandwidth management is used to prioritize Internet usage per application and per user on the network. It allows network administrators to allocate and control the available network bandwidth for different applications and users based on their specific needs or priorities. This helps in ensuring that critical applications or users receive the necessary bandwidth while preventing non-essential applications from consuming excessive resources.

Selected Answer: A
A. Bandwidth management.
key word is per application, load balancer doesnt optimise traffic per application it does it by balancing traffic per link

Selected Answer: A
BW management, for lan users and lan applications - example WAP setup SSID and limit BW to 2meg for BOYD devices. option is is load balancing ROUTING, we not routing on the LAN yet, were setting policies on the LAN.
Definitely load balancing

Selected Answer: B
Bandwidth management focuses on the availabliilty of the whole network. It looks like this could be LB routing since you can refine how you want to prioritise the network usage per app and user on a network
Bandwidth management is for monitoring only, no?

comments.content: The book answer is QoS but there is none. Bandwidth management is the only logical choice out of all choices. Bandwidth management as the name imply control bandwidth, it isn't just a netflow analyser.

According to the object 2.2 Bandwidth management

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to prioritize Internet usage per application and per user on the network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
This is not encrypted SNMP packet. 
Needs SNMPv3 & community string.

Selected Answer: CD
C. Set a private community string.
D. Use SNMPv3.

C. Set a private community string:
The "community: public" line indicates that the default community string "public" is being used for SNMP requests. This is a well-known community string that is often used for testing but should not be used in production environments.
Changing the community string to a private, unique value is essential to prevent unauthorized access. Only devices with the correct community string can access SNMP data.

D. SNMPv3:
SNMPv3 is the most secure version of SNMP. It provides authentication, data integrity, and encryption features to protect SNMP traffic.
By using SNMPv3, the administrator can ensure that SNMP traffic is secure and protected from unauthorized access and data tampering.
D and E snmpv3 dosent use community string V1 and v2 do. "Transport Layer Security is the next generation of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and has been added to the SNMPv3 architecture."

Selected Answer: DF
Correct answers are D "Use SNMPv3" and F "Utilize IPSec tunneling". This is from CertMaster's The Official CompTIA Network+ Student Guide (p. 464):

"For example, the original versions of SNMP are unencrypted. To implement secure SNMP, either configure SNMPv3, which supports encryption, or use an encapsulation protocol such as IPSec to encrypt SNMP traffic."

The community (option C) is just like a password for SNMP, which in this case is the word "public". Setting a private community string does not make much sense.

comments.content: I apologize for the mistake in my previous comment. SNMPv3 does not use community string and therefore should bot be used along with SNMPv3 as option. I will go for SSL in addition to SNMPv3.
Community string can be Private in SNMPv3

discussion.content:
C. Set a private community string and D. Use SNMPv3.
 the packet contains a community string of "public," which is the default community string for SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c. The administrator should set a private community string, which is a custom string used for SNMP authentication and authorization, to replace the default string.
